heaviest_rainfall.status: The most intense rainfall recorded took place on 04 January 2025, with precipitation totalling 36.8mm.  The rain fell at 4.6mm per hour at times over the course of the 37.2 hour storm.

heaviest_rainrate.status: 27.0mm per hour is the maximum rain rate ever recorded on 02 September 2025, during a 15.0 hour storm which dumped 21.19mm of rain from the clouds.

longest_rain.status: The record duration for continuous rain was set on 04 January 2025, the storm lasted 37.2 hours with a total precipitation of 36.8mm and it reached 4.6mm per hour at times.

most_lightning.status: The most lightning strikes in one day since 11 April 2025 is 23 and it happened on 07 September 2025.

storm.status: A storm is passing through the area.  This marks the first storm since 24 October 2025.

top_10_dry.status: The longest dry period started on 24 April 2025 and lasted for 19 days.

top_10_rainy.status: The ongoing rainy stretch, 9 days and counting started on 18 October 2025 and ranks 6th in length since records started in 23 September 2024.  The longest rainy period started on 30 November 2024 and lasted for 10 days.

cold_snaps.status: There is not a cold snap right now.  There have been 6 this year, compared to a usual average of 3.7.

extreme.status: The largest temperature difference recorded was 26.7°C on 29 April 2025.  On that date the temperature reached 27.1°C and fell to 0.4°C.

heatwaves.status: There is not a heatwaves right now.  There have been 6 this year, compared to a usual average of 1.9.

tropical.status: The previous tropical night was on 18 July 2025, with only 62 in total since 1973.

average.status: The current average daily wind direction is southerly (195°).  In the UK, a southerly wind usually brings milder, moist air from the Atlantic.

gusts.status: 93.7 mph is the largest wind gust recorded on 13 October 2012.

run.status: The largest wind run ever was on 21 October 2012 with a value of 1737 miles.

speed.status: To date, the maximum wind speed recorded is 93.7 mph on 13 October 2012.

top_10_windy.status: The longest windy period started on 11 October 2012 and lasted for 21 days.

summary.description:
Today, cooler for the feels like temperature (down 3.3°C), outside temperature (down 3.1°C), and inside temperature (down 1.8°C) and drier conditions in rainfall (down 0.2 mm).

The past week and month had observable variation in feels like temperature (up 7.2°C), dew point temperature (up 5.4°C), cloud levels (up 404 m), and outside temperature (up 6.6°C) when compared to today.

cloud levels.description:
Today’s average cloud levels is 67.8m lower than yesterday, 75.1m lower than the past week, 404.4m lower than the past month.

The cloud levels for yesterday ranged from 732m to 1468m and averaged 942.0m, while the past week and month indicated warmer conditions.
cloud levels.summary: Expect overcast skies with low cloud.

summary.summary: Inside; temperature should remain cool. Outside; cold spells are likely. Also, dry air conditions likely prevail and little or no wind. A few light raindrops may fall, overcast skies with low cloud, and it’s dark. Changeable conditions.

washing.phrase: It is nighttime; if you have washing out then bring it in as it will probably get damper overnight.
